unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Job Satisfaction Survey - Confidence Interval
question_text: Suppose $500\text{ randomly selected employees}$ were asked if they are satisfied with their current job. Of those surveyed, $261\text{ employees}$ responded that they were satisfied with their current job. What conclusions can we gather from a $90\%$ confidence interval constructed from this data?

choices.text: This interval gives us strong evidence that more than 50 % 50 % of people are happy with their job.
We are 90 % 90 % confident that between about 47.8 % 47.8 % and 56.6 % 56.6 % of all employed people are satisfied with their current job.
We are 90 % 90 % confident that between about 47.8 % 47.8 % and 56.6 % 56.6 % of people sampled in this survey are satisfied with their current job.
We are 90 % 90 % confident that between about 48.5 % 48.5 % and 55.9 % 55.9 % of all employed people are satisfied with their current job.
We are 90 % 90 % confident more individuals are happy with their current job than dissatisfied with their current job.
